name: ChimArena
description:
Welcome to the ChimArena!

Spend some time exploring wild, technicolor Chimeras in this proof-of-concept turned mini game: First breed your own Chimera and then test it against a never ending stream of other Chimeras!

The Chimera Breeding is based on actual genetics, inheriting each trait from either parent and even considering a chance of mutation, whereas the battle system is turn-based with a bit of a twist: Every turn you get to select two moves, but then the moves of all Chimeras are executed simultaneously, so try to predict how the battlefield will change!

Tips and known Bugs

- A Chimeras maximum scores are limited by it's body parts. It's individual scores are inherited relative to their maximum scores; think of the Chimera scores like EVs in Pokémon.

- You have to actively submit your high score to the leaderboard using the "Submit" button, but it will always submit your highest score ever, not your most recent one (unless it's the highest of course)

- In Battle, if there are many Chimeras on the board they will eventually start glitching into each other. That's because of the way the movement system works and not easily fixable.
